markdownRemark.html:
3 ways to define a function:

function bla() { return null }

const blo = () => { return null }

() => onClickZ(name, last) { return null }

Above functions would be called like this: bla() blo() onClickZ(name, last)

Parenthesis mean call function immediately and output whatever is in the return.

Referencing a function needs to be without parenthesis: bla blo onClick
